title: Reinforcement Learning Outperforms Supervised Fine-Tuning: A Case Study on Audio Question Answering
author: Gang Li (Xiaomi Corporation), Jizhong Liu (Xiaomi Corporation), Heinrich Dinkel (Xiaomi Corporation), Yadong Niu (Xiaomi Corporation), Junbo Zhang (Xiaomi Corporation), Jian Luan (Xiaomi Corporation), ...
relevance_why: The paper directly addresses Audio Question Answering (AQA), making it highly relevant for Haohe Liu's interests in audio processing, specifically its unique exploration of applying reinforcement learning to LALMs.
background: Audio Question Answering is a multimodal task that involves generating accurate responses to questions based on audio content, integrating auditory and linguistic modalities.
contribution: This paper introduces the Group Relative Policy Optimization algorithm to enhance reasoning capabilities in large audio language models for AQA, achieving state-of-the-art performance with an accuracy of 64.5%.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous methods primarily relied on supervised fine-tuning, requiring large datasets for effective training.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work shows that reinforcement learning can outperform supervised methods even with small datasets, demonstrating better efficiency and generalization capabilities.

key_innovation: Utilizes reinforcement learning techniques that require fewer training samples and perform better than traditional approaches in a complex audio understanding context.
real_world_impact: The findings indicate that reinforcement learning can improve AQA systems, leading to enhanced audio understanding applications like automated customer service or interactive audio-based learning environments.
limitations: The explicit reasoning process does not significantly benefit AQA tasks, indicating a need for further exploration.

new_terms.Group Relative Policy Optimization: **Group Relative Policy Optimization** is a reinforcement learning algorithm designed to optimize the performance of models in contexts with multiple response options by leveraging group evaluation of outputs.

open_sourcing: Our project is available at https://github.com/xiaomi/r1-aqa and https://huggingface.co/mispeech/r1-aqa.
